intro: Minuartia hamata, commonly known as the hooked rockcress, is a low-growing, mat-forming plant native to rocky and alpine environments. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many flowering plants with small, four-petaled flowers. The plant features pale green, succulent leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, and its flowers are typically white or pale yellow. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to harsh, sunny conditions. Minuartia hamata is often found in mountainous regions of Europe, Asia, and North America.
